reviews.text:
Title: BRF Output Formatting Enhancements for Pagination and Accessibility

Description:
Update the BRF (Braille Ready Format) output generator to enforce a strict limit of 40 cells per line to comply with standard tactile display and embossing device constraints.
Additionally, ensure that pagination begins from page 1—page 0 must be explicitly disallowed to avoid indexing errors and alignment issues in downstream tools.
reviews.reason_text: Enforce pagination starting from page 1, disallowing page 0.

reviews.text: A tactile page break marker "⠿⠿" must be inserted at the end of each page to assist with both manual review and automated parsing by assistive hardware.
reviews.reason_text: Insert tactile marker at end of each page.

reviews.text: This marker should be consistent and placed on a new line following the final line of each page.
reviews.reason_text: Marker placement constraint on new line after final page.

reviews.text:
Test Plan:
Include a regression test case simulating a 1,000-page BRF document, ensuring no overflow occurs beyond 40 cells/line, page numbering remains sequential from 1, and all page breaks render correctly with the "⠿⠿" symbol.

Priority: High
Impact: Prevents tactile display overflow, improves document readability and navigability for visually impaired users, and aligns with assistive device formatting standards.
Failure to implement may result in unreadable output and increased user error.
